1.name: The Federation of Sol
1.agentAbility: At the start of a ground combat round: You may exhaust this card to choose 1 ground force in the active system; that ground force rolls 1 additional die during this combat round.
1.commanderAbility: At the start of a ground combat on a planet you control: You may place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on that planet.
1.commanderUnlock: Control planets that have a combined total of at least 12 resources.
1.heroAbility: Remove each of your command tokens from the game board and return them to your reinforcements. Then, purge this card.

abilities.effect: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place 2 infantry from your reinforcements on 1 planet you control.
When you gain command tokens during the status phase, gain 1 additional command token.

technologies.effect: At the end of the status phase, place 1 infantry from your reinforcements in this system’s space area.

technologies.deploy: After you use your ORBITAL DROP faction ability, you may spend 3 resources to place 1 mech on that planet.

technologies.effect: After this unit is destroyed, roll 1 die. If the result is 5 or greater, place the unit on this card. At the start of your next turn, place each unit that is on this card on a planet you control in your home system.

promissory.effect: At the start of the Sol player’s turn: Remove 1 token from the Sol player’s strategy pool, if able, and return it to his reinforcements. Then, you may place 2 infantry from your reinforcements on any planet you control.

2.name: The Mentak Coalition
2.agentAbility: After the faction ability is used against another player: You may exhaust this card; if you do, you and that player each draw 1 action card.
2.commanderAbility: After you win a space combat: You may force your opponent to give you 1 promissory note from their hand.
2.commanderUnlock: Have 4 cruisers on the game board.
2.heroAbility: At the start of a space combat that you are participating in: You may purge this card; if you do, for each other player's ship that is destroyed during this combat, place 1 ship of that type from your reinforcements in the active system.

abilities.effect: At the start of a space combat, you may roll 1 die for each of up to 2 of your cruisers or destroyers in the system. For each result equal to or greater than that ship’s combat value, produce 1 hit; your opponent must assign it to 1 of his ships.
After 1 of your neighbors gains trade goods or resolves a transaction, if he has 3 or more trade goods, you may take 1 of his trade goods or commodities.

technologies.effect: Other players’ ships in this system cannot use SUSTAIN DAMAGE.
Other players’ ground forces on this planet cannot use SUSTAIN DAMAGE.

technologies.description: After you win or lose a space combat, gain 1 trade good; if you won the combat, you may also produce 1 ship in that system of any ship type that was destroyed during the combat.
When you spend trade goods, each trade good is worth 2 resources or influence instead of 1.

promissory.effect: Place this card faceup in your play area. While this card is in your play area, the Mentak player cannot use his PILLAGE faction ability against you. If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Mentak player’s units, return this card.

3.name: The Yin Brotherhood
3.agentAbility: After a player's destroyer or cruiser is destroyed: You may exhaust this card; if you do, that player may place up to 2 fighters from their Reinforcements in that unit's system.
3.commanderAbility: This card satisfies a green technology prerequisite. You may produce 1 additional infantry for their cost; these additional infantry do not count against your PRODUCTION limit.
3.heroAbility: For each planet that contains any number of your infantry, either ready that planet or place an equal number of infantry from your reinforcements on that planet. Then, purge this card.

abilities.effect: At the start of a ground combat, you may spend 2 influence to replace 1 of your opponent’s participating infantry with 1 infantry from your reinforcements.
After each space battle round, you may destroy 1 of your cruisers or destroyers in the active system to produce 1 hit and assign it to 1 of your opponent’s ships in that system.

technologies.effect: When this ship is destroyed, destroy all ships in this system.

technologies.deploy: When you use your INDOCTRINATION faction ability, you may spend 1 additional influence to replace your opponent’s unit with 1 mech instead of 1 infantry.

technologies.description: After you produce units, place up to 2 infantry from your reinforcements on any planet you control or in any space area that contains 1 or more of your ships.

At the start of a space combat, you may destroy 1 of your cruisers or destroyers in the active system to produce 1 hit against your opponent’s ships; your opponent must assign that hit to 1 of his non-fighter ships, if able.

promissory.effect: At the start of a ground combat against 2 or more ground forces that are not controlled by the Yin player: Replace 1 of your opponent’s infantry with 1 infantry from your reinforcements. Then, return this card to the Yin player.

4.name: The Embers of Muaat
4.agentAbility: Exhaust this card to choose a player; that player may produce up to 2 units that each have a cost of 4 or less in a system that contains 1 of their war suns or their flagship.
4.commanderAbility: After you spend token from your strategy pool: You may gain 1 trade good.
4.heroAbility: After you move a war sun into a nonhome system other than Mecatol Rex: You may destroy all other players' units in that system and replace that system tile with the Muaat supernova tile. If you do, purge this card and each planet card that corresponds to the replaced system tile.

abilities.effect: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place either 2 fighters or 1 destroyer from your reinforcements in a system that contains 1 or more of your war suns.
Your ships can move through supernovas.

technologies.action: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place 1 cruiser in this unit’s system.

technologies.effect: When you use your STAR FORGE faction ability in this system or an adjacent system, you may place 1 infantry from your reinforcements with this unit.
Other players’ units in this system lose PLANETARY SHIELD.

technologies.description: Your ships can move into supernovas. Each supernova that contains 1 or more of your units gains the PRODUCTION 5 ability as if it were 1 of your units.

technologies.effect: Other players’ units in this system lose PLANETARY SHIELD.

promissory.effect: Remove 1 token from the Muaat player’s fleet pool and return it to his reinforcements. Then, gain your war sun unit upgrade technology card. Then, return this card to the Muaat player.

5.name: The Arborec
5.agentAbility: Exhaust this card and choose a player's non-fighter ship; that player may replace that ship with 1 from their reinforcements that costs up to 2 more than the replaced ship
5.commanderAbility: After another player activates a system that has 1 or more of your units that have PRODUCTION: produce 1 unit in that system.
5.commanderUnlock: Have 12 ground forces on planets you control.
5.heroAbility: Produce any number of units in any number of systems that contain or more of your ground forces. Then, purge this card.

abilities.effect: Your space docks cannot produce infantry. At the start of the status phase, place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on any planet you control.

technologies.effect: After you activate this system, you may produce up to 5 units in this system.

technologies.deploy: When you would use your MITOSIS faction ability, you may replace 1 of your infantry with 1 mech from your reinforcements instead.

technologies.description: At the end of the status phase, you may remove any number of infantry from planets you control and place them on 1 or more planets you control in the same or adjacent systems.

technologies.effect: After this unit is destroyed, roll 1 die. If the result is 6 or greater, place the unit on this card. At the start of your next turn, place each unit that is on this card on a planet you control in your home system.

promissory.effect: After another player moves ships into a system that contains 1 or more of your units: You may place 1 command token from that player’s reinforcements in any non-home system. Then, return this card to the Arborec player.

6.name: The Lizix Mindnet
6.agentAbility: After a player activates a system: You may exhaust this card to allow that player to replace 1 of their infantry in the active system with 1 mech from their reinforcements.
6.commanderAbility: Units that have PLANETARY SHIELD do not prevent you from using BOMBARDMENT.
6.commanderUnlock: Have 4 dreadnoughts on the game board.
6.heroAbility: Choose system that does not contain other players' ships; you may move your flagship and any number of your dreadnoughts from other systems into the chosen system. Then, purge this card.

abilities.effect: When you gain control of a planet, replace each PDS and space dock that is on that planet with a matching unit from your reinforcements.
At the end of each round of ground combat, your ships in the active system may use their BOMBARDMENT abilities against your opponent’s ground forces on that planet.

technologies.effect: During a space combat, hits produced by this ship and by your dreadnoughts in this system must be assigned to non-fighter ships if able.
While not participating in ground combat, this unit can use its BOMBARDMENT ability on planets in its system as if it were a ship.

technologies.description: You may exhaust this card and spend 2 resources when you research a technology; ignore all of that technology’s prerequisites.

technologies.effect: This unit cannot be destroyed by 'Direct Hit' action cards.

promissory.effect: When you gain command tokens during the status phase: Gain 1 additional command token. Then, return this card to the L1Z1X player.

7.name: The Winnu
7.agentAbility: When 1 or more of a player's units use PRODUCTION: You may exhaust this card to reduce the combined cost of the produced units by 2.
7.commanderAbility: During combat: Apply +2 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls in the Mecatol Rex system, your home system, and each system that contains a legendary planet.
7.commanderUnlock: Control Mecatol Rex or enter into a combat in the Mecatol Rex system.
7.heroAbility: Perform the primary ability of any strategy card. Then, choose any number of other players. Those players may perform the secondary ability of that strategy card. Then, purge this card.

abilities.effect: You do not have to spend influence to remove the custodians token from Mecatol Rex.
After you resolve a tactical action during which you gained control of Mecatol Rex, you may place 1 PDS and 1 space dock from your reinforcements on Mecatol Rex.

technologies.effect: When this unit makes a combat roll, it rolls a number of dice equal to the number of your opponent’s non-fighter ships in this system.
After you resolve a tactical action during which you gained control of this planet, you may place 1 PDS or 1 space dock from your reinforcements on this planet.

technologies.description: Exhaust this card when 1 or more of your units use PRODUCTION; swap the resource and influence values of 1 planet you control during that use of PRODUCTION.

During your tactical actions, if you do not control Mecatol Rex, treat its system as if it contains both an alpha and beta wormhole. If you control Mecatol Rex, exhaust this card to place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on Mecatol Rex.

promissory.effect: When the Winnu player resolves a strategic action: You do not have to spend or place a command token to resolve the secondary ability of that strategy card. Then, return this card to the Winnu player.

8.name: The Nekro Virus
8.agentAbility: During the action phase: You may exhaust this card to choose a player; that player may discard 1 action card or spend 1 command token from their Rommand sheet to gain 2 trade goods.
8.commanderAbility: After you gain a technology: You may draw 1 action card.
8.commanderUnlock: Own 3 technologies. A Valefar Assimilator technology counts only if its X or Y token is on a technology.
8.heroAbility: Choose a planet that has technology specialty in system that contains your units. Destroy any other player's units on that planet. Gain trade goods equal to the planet's combined resource and influence values and gain 1 technology that matches the specialty of that planet. Then, purge this card.

abilities.effect: You cannot vote on agendas. Once per agenda phase, after an agenda is revealed, you may predict aloud the outcome of that agenda. If your prediction is correct, gain 1 technology that is owned by a player who voted how you predicted.
Once per combat, after 1 of your opponent’s units is destroyed, you may gain 1 technology that is owned by that player.
You cannot research technology. When you would research a technology, gain 3 command tokens instead.

technologies.effect: At the start of a space combat, choose any number of your ground forces in this system to participate in that combat as if they were ships.
During combat against an opponent who has an 'X' or 'Y' token on 1 or more of their technologies, apply +2 to the result of this unit’s combat rolls.

technologies.description: When you would gain another player’s technology using 1 of your faction abilities, you may place an assimilator token on a faction technology owned by that player instead. While that token is on a technology, this card gains that technology’s text. You cannot place an assimilator token on technology that already has an assimilator token.

When you would gain another player’s technology using 1 of your faction abilities, you may place an assimilator token on a faction technology owned by that player instead. While that token is on a technology, this card gains that technology’s text. You cannot place an assimilator token on technology that already has an assimilator token.

promissory.effect: At the start of a combat: Place this card faceup in your play area. While this card is in your play area, the Nekro player cannot use his TECHNOLOGICAL SINGULARITY ability against you.

9.name: The Naalu Collective
9.agentAbility: After an agenda is revealed: You may exhaust this card to look at the top card of the agenda deck. Then, you may show that card to 1 other player.
9.commanderAbility: You may produce 1 additional fighter for their cost; these additional units do not count against your PRODUCTION limit.
9.commanderUnlock: Have 12 fighters on the game board.
9.heroAbility: At the end of the status phase: You may force each other player to give you 1 promissory note from their hand. If you do, purge this card.

abilities.effect: At the end of the strategy phase, place the Naalu '0' token on your strategy card; you are first in initiative order.

After another player moves ships into a system that contains 1 or more of your ships, you may place 1 token from your strategy pool in an adjacent system that does not contain another player's ships; move your ships from the active system into that system.

technologies.effect: During an invasion in this system, you may commit fighters to planets as if they were ground forces. When combat ends, return those units to the space area.
During combat against an opponent who has at least 1 relic fragment, apply +2 to the results of this unit’s combat rolls.

technologies.description: After another player activates a system that contains 1 or more of your ships, that player removes 1 token from his fleet pool and returns it to his reinforcements.

technologies.effect: This unit may move without being transported. Each fighter in excess of your ships' capacity counts as ½ of a ship against your fleet pool.

promissory.effect: At the end of the strategy phase: Place this card faceup in your play area and place the Naalu '0' token on your strategy card; you are first in initiative order.

10.name: The Barony of Letnev
10.agentAbility: At the start of a space combat round: You may exhaust this card to choose 1 ship in the active system; that ship rolls 1 additional die during this combat round.
10.commanderAbility: After 1 of your units uses SUSTAIN DAMAGE: You may gain 1 trade good.
10.heroAbility: Place this card near the game board; the number of non-fighter ships you have in systems is not limited by laws or by the number of command tokens in your fleet pool during this game round. At the end of that game round, purge this card.

abilities.effect: At the start of each round of space combat, you may spend 2 trade goods; you may reroll any number of your dice during that combat round.
The maximum number of non-fighter ships you can have in each system is equal to 2 more than the number of tokens in your fleet pool.

technologies.effect: Other players’ units in this system lose PLANETARY SHIELD. At the start of each space combat round, repair this ship.

technologies.deploy: At the start of a round of ground combat, you may spend 2 resources to replace 1 of your infantry in that combat with 1 mech.

technologies.description: When 1 of your units uses SUSTAIN DAMAGE, cancel 2 hits instead of 1.
During an invasion, units cannot use SPACE CANNON against your units.

promissory.effect: After you and your opponent roll dice during space combat: You may reroll all of your opponent’s dice. You may reroll any number of your dice. Then, return this card to the Letnev player.

11.name: The Clan of Saar
11.agentAbility: After a player activates a system: You may exhaust this card to increase the move value of 1 of that player's ships to match the move value of the ship on the game board that has the highest move value.
11.commanderAbility: When you produce fighters or infantry: You may place each of those units at any of your space docks that are not blockaded.
11.commanderUnlock: Have 3 space docks on the game board.
11.heroAbility: Choose system hat is adjacent to of your space docks. Destroy all other players' infantry and fighters in that system. Then, purge this card.

abilities.effect: After you gain control of a planet, gain 1 trade good.
You can score objectives even if you do not control the planets in your home system.

technologies.deploy: After you gain control of a planet, you may spend 1 trade good to place 1 mech on that planet.

technologies.effect: This unit is placed in a space area instead of on a planet. This unit can move and retreat as if it were a ship. If this unit is blockaded, it is destroyed.

technologies.description: Other players cannot activate asteroid fields that contain 1 or more of your ships. At the start of your turn during the action phase, you may produce 1 unit in a system that contains at least 1 of your units that has PRODUCTION.

technologies.effect: This unit is placed in a space area instead of on a planet. This unit can move and retreat as if it were a ship. If this unit is blockaded, it is destroyed.

promissory.effect: After you commit 1 or more of your units to land on a planet: Remove all of the Saar player’s ground forces from that planet and place them on a planet controlled by the Saar player.

12.name: The Universities of Jol-Nar
12.agentAbility: When player spends resources to research: You may exhaust this card to allow that player to remove any number of their infantry from the game board. For each unit removed, reduce the resources spent by 1.
12.commanderAbility: After you roll dice for a unit ability: You may reroll any number of those dice.
12.heroAbility: For each non-unit upgrade technology you own, you may replace that technology with any technology of the same color from the deck. Then, purge this card.

abilities.effect: Apply -1 to the result of each of your unit’s combat rolls.
When you spend a command token to resolve the secondary ability of the 'Technology' strategy card, you may resolve the primary ability instead.
When you research a technology that is not a unit upgrade technology, you may ignore 1 prerequisite.

technologies.effect: When making a combat roll for this ship, each result of 9 or 10, before applying modifiers, produces 2 additional hits.
Your infantry on this planet are not affected by your FRAGILE faction ability.

technologies.description: You may exhaust this card after you activate a system that contains 1 or more of your units; that system is adjacent to all other systems that contain 1 or more of your units during this activation.
After another player activates a system that contains 1 or more of your ships, gain 4 trade goods.

promissory.effect: After the Jol-Nar player researches a technology that is not a faction technology: Gain that technology. Then, return this card to the Jol-Nar player.

13.name: Sardakk N'orr
13.agentAbility: At the end of a player's tactical action: You may exhaust this card; if you do, that player may place 2 infantry from their reinforcements on a planet they control in the active system.
13.commanderAbility: During the Commit Ground Forces step: You can commit up to 1 ground force from each planet in the active system and each planet in adjacent systems that do not contain 1 of your command tokens.
13.heroAbility: After you move ships into the active system: You may skip directly to the Commit Ground Forces step. If you do, after you commit ground forces to land on planets, purge this card and return each of your ships in the active system to your reinforcements.

abilities.effect: Apply +1 to the result of each of your unit’s combat rolls.

technologies.effect: Apply +1 to the result of each of your other ship's combat rolls in this system.
After this unit uses its SUSTAIN DAMAGE ability during ground combat, it produces 1 hit against your opponent’s ground forces on this planet.

technologies.description: After making combat rolls during a round of ground combat, if your opponent produced 1 or more hits, you produce 1 additional hit.

technologies.effect: This unit cannot be destroyed by “Direct Hit” action cards. After a round of space combat, you may destroy this unit to destroy up to 2 ships in this system.

promissory.effect: At the start of an invasion combat: Apply +1 to the result of each of your unit’s combat rolls during this combat. If your opponent is the N’orr player, apply -1 to the result of each of his unit’s combat rolls during this combat.

14.name: The Xxcha Kingdom
14.agentAbility: Exhaust this card to ready any planet; if that planet is in a system that is adjacent to a planet you control, you may remove 1 infantry from that planet and return it to its reinforcements.
14.commanderAbility: Each planet that you exhaust to cast votes provides additional vote. Game effects cannot prevent you from voting on an agenda.
14.commanderUnlock: Control planets that have a combined total of at least 12 influence.
14.heroAbility: You may discard 1 law from play. Look at the top 5 cards of the agenda deck. Choose 2 to reveal, and resolve each as if you had cast 1 vote for an outcome of your choice; then discard the rest. Other players cannot resolve abilities during this action.Then, purge this card.

abilities.effect: After you resolve the primary or secondary ability of the 'Diplomacy' strategy card, you may gain control of 1 planet other than Mecatol Rex that does not contain any units and is in a system that is adjacent to a planet you control.
When an agenda is revealed, you may spend 1 token from your strategy pool to discard that agenda and reveal 1 agenda from the top of the deck. Players vote on this agenda instead.

technologies.effect: You may use this unit’s SPACE CANNON against ships that are in adjacent systems.
You may use this unit’s SPACE CANNON against ships that are in adjacent systems.

technologies.description: You may exhaust this card and spend 1 token from your strategy pool when another player plays an action card; cancel that action card.
After another player activates a system that contains 1 or more of your ships, you may exhaust this card and spend 1 token from your strategy pool; immediately end that player’s turn.

promissory.effect: When an agenda is revealed: Remove 1 token from the Xxcha player’s strategy pool and return it to his reinforcements. Then, discard the revealed agenda and reveal 1 agenda from the top of the deck. Players vote on this agenda instead.

15.name: The Yssaril Tribes
15.agentAbility: This card has the text ability of each other player's agent, even if that agent is exhausted.
15.commanderAbility: After another player activates a system that contains your units: You may look at that player's action cards, promissory notes, or secret objectives.
15.heroAbility: Each other player you 1 action card from their hand. For each player, you may either take that card or force that player to discard 3 random action cards from their hand. Then, purge this card.

abilities.effect: Discard 1 action card from your hand.
When you draw 1 or more action cards, draw 1 additional action card. Then, choose and discard 1 action card from your hand.
You can have any number of action cards in your hand. Game effects cannot prevent you from using this ability.

technologies.effect: This ship can move through systems that contain other players’ ships.

technologies.deploy: After you use your STALL TACTICS faction ability, you may place 1 mech on a planet you control.

technologies.description: During your turn of the action phase, players that have passed cannot play action cards.
Exhaust this card to look at another player’s hand of action cards. Choose 1 of those cards and add it to your hand.

promissory.effect: At the start of your turn: Look at the Yssaril player’s hand of action cards. Choose 1 of those cards and add it to your hand. Then, return this card to the Yssaril player.

16.name: The Emirates of Hacan
16.agentAbility: During the action phase: You may exhaust this card to gain 2 commodities or replenish another player's commodities.
16.commanderAbility: When you cast votes: You may spend any number of trade goods. Cast 2 additional votes for each trade good spent.
16.heroAbility: When 1 or more of your units use PRODUCTION: You may reduce the cost of each of your units to 0 during this use of PRODUCTION. If you do, purge this card.

abilities.effect: You do not have to spend a command token to resolve the secondary ability of the 'Trade' strategy card.
You can negotiate transactions with players who are not your neighbors.
When you are negotiating a transaction, action cards can be exchanged as part of that transaction.

technologies.effect: After you roll a die during a space combat in this system, you may spend 1 trade good to apply +1 to the result.
This planet’s planet card may be traded as part of a transaction; if you do, move all of your units from this planet to another planet you control.

technologies.description: Exhaust this card and spend 1 token from your strategy pool to gain 4 trade goods and choose 1 other player; that player gains 2 trade goods.

At the end of the strategy phase, you may spend 1 token from your strategy pool and give another player 3 of your trade goods. If you do, give 1 of your strategy cards to that player and take 1 of his strategy cards.

promissory.effect: Place this card faceup in your play area. While this card is in your play area, you may negotiate transactions with players who are not your neighbor. If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Hacan player’s units, return this card to the Hacan player.

17.name: The Ghosts of Creuss
17.agentAbility: After a player activates a system that contains a non-delta wormhole: You may exhaust this card; if you do, that system is adjacent to all other systems that contain a wormhole during this tactical action.
17.commanderAbility: After your ships move: For each ship that has a capacity value and moved through 1 or more wormholes, you may place 1 fighter from your reinforcements with that ship if you have unused capacity in the active system.
17.commanderUnlock: Have 3 units in 3 systems that contain alpha or beta wormholes.
17.heroAbility: Swap the positions of any 2 systems that contain wormholes or your units, other than the Creuss system and the wormhole nexus. Then, purge this card.

abilities.effect: You treat all systems that contain either an alpha or beta wormhole as adjacent to each other. Game effects cannot prevent you from using this ability.
During your tactical actions, apply +1 to the move value of each of your ships that starts its movement in your home system or in a system that contains either an alpha or beta wormhole.
When you create the game board, place the Creuss Gate where your home system would normally be placed. The Creuss Gate is not a home system. Then, place your home system in your play area.

technologies.effect: This ship’s system contains a delta wormhole. During movement, this ship may move before or after your other ships.
After any player activates a system, you may remove this unit from the game board to place or move a Creuss wormhole token into this system.

technologies.description: Exhaust this card to place or move a Creuss wormhole token into either a system that contains a planet you control or a non-home system that does not contain another player’s ships.
At the start of a space combat in a system that contains a wormhole and 1 or more of your ships, you may produce 1 hit and assign it to 1 of your opponent’s ships.

promissory.effect: At the start of your turn during the action phase: Place or move a Creuss wormhole token into either a system that contains a planet you control or a non-home system that does not contain another player’s ships.

52.name: The Mahact Gene-sorcerers
52.agentAbility: When you would spend a command token during the secondary ability of a strategic action: You may exhaust this card to remove 1 of the active player's command tokens from the board and use it instead.
52.commanderAbility: During your tactical actions, you can activate systems that contain your command tokens. If you do, return both command tokens to your reinforcements at the end of your turn.
52.commanderUnlock: Have 2 other factions' command tokens in your fleet pool.
52.heroAbility: all units in the space area of any system to an adjacent system that contains a different player's ships. Space combat is resolved in that system; neither player can retreat or resolve abilities that would move their ships. Then,purge this card.

abilities.effect: When you win a combat, place 1 command token from your opponent’s reinforcements in your fleet pool if it does not already contain 1; other players’ tokens increase your fleet limit but cannot be redistributed.
While another player’s command token is in your fleet pool, you can use the ability of that player’s commander, if it is unlocked.
During setup, purge your 'Alliance' promissory note. Other players cannot give you their “Alliance” promissory note.

technologies.effect: During combat against an opponent whose command token is not in your fleet pool, apply +2 to the results of this unit’s combat rolls.
After a player activates this system, you may spend 1 of their tokens from your fleet pool to end their turn; they gain that token.
After this unit is destroyed, gain 1 commodity or convert 1 of your commodities to a trade good.

technologies.description: You may exhaust this card before a player casts votes; that player must cast at least 1 vote for an outcome of your choice or remove 1 fleet token.

technologies.effect: After this unit is destroyed, gain 1 commodity or convert 1 commodity. Then, place the unit on this card. At the start of your next turn, place each unit that is on this card on a planet you control in your home system.

promissory.effect: At the start of the strategy phase: Choose 1 non-home system that contains your units; each other player who has a token on the Mahact command sheet places a token from their reinforcements into that system.

53.name: The Nomad
agentAbility: When you gain trade goods from the supply: You may exhaust this card to place an equal number of trade goods on this card. When this card readies, gain the trade goods on this card.
At the end of a player's turn: You may exhaust this card to allow that player to remove 2 of their ground forces from the game board and place them on planets they control in the active system.
After the Roll Dice step of combat: You may exhaust this card. If you do, hits are not assigned to either player's units. Return to the start of this combat round's Roll Dice step.
53.commanderAbility: You can produce your flagship without spending resources.
53.heroAbility: Place this card near the game board; your flagship and units it transports can move out of systems that contain your command tokens during this game round. At the end of that game round, purge this card.

abilities.effect: During setup, take the 2 additional Nomad faction agents and place them next to your faction sheet; you have 3 agents.
During the agenda phase, after an outcome you voted for or predicted is resolved, gain 1 trade good.

technologies.effect: You may treat this unit as if it were adjacent to systems that contain 1 or more of your mechs.
While this unit is in a space area during combat, you may use its SUSTAIN DAMAGE ability to cancel a hit produced against your ships in this system.

technologies.description: After any player’s agent becomes exhausted, you may exhaust this card to ready that agent; if you ready another player’s agent, you may perform a transaction with that player.

technologies.effect: You may treat this unit as if it were adjacent to systems that contain 1 or more of your mechs.

promissory.effect: At the start of a space combat against a player other than the Nomad: During this combat, treat 1 of your non-fighter ships as if it has the SUSTAIN DAMAGE ability, combat value, and ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE values of the Nomad’s flagship. Return this card to the Nomad player at the end of the combat.

54.name: The Vuil'raith Cabal
54.agentAbility: After another player replenishes commodities: You may exhaust this card to convert their commodities to trade goods and capture 1 unit from their reinforcements that has a cost equal to or lower than their commodity value.
54.commanderAbility: When you produce fighter or infantry units: Up 2 of those units do not count against your PRODUCTION limit.
54.heroAbility: Each player rolls die for each of his non-fighter ships that are in or adjacent to system contains dimensional tear; on a 1-3 capture that unit. If this causes a player's ground forces or fighter to be removed, also capture those units. Then, purge this card.

abilities.effect: Capture your opponent’s non-structure units that are destroyed during combat.
When you produce a unit, you may return 1 captured unit of that type to produce that unit without spending resources.
When you research a unit upgrade technology, you may return 1 captured unit of that type to ignore all of that technology’s prerequisites.

technologies.effect: Capture all other non-structure units that are destroyed in this unit’s system, including your own.
When your infantry on this planet are destroyed, place them on your faction sheet; those units are captured.
This system is a gravity rift; your ships do not roll for this gravity rift. Up to 6 fighters in this system do not count against your ships’ capacity.
This system is a gravity rift; your ships do not roll for this gravity rift. Up to 12 fighters in this system do not count against your ships’ capacity.

technologies.description: Exhaust this card to choose another player’s non-structure unit in a system that is adjacent to 1 or more of your space docks. Capture 1 unit of that type from that player’s reinforcements.

promissory.effect: After you activate a system: Your ships do not roll for gravity rifts during this movement; apply an additional +1 to the move values of your ships that would move out of or through a gravity rift instead.

55.name: The Titans of Ul
55.agentAbility: When a hit is produced against a unit: You may exhaust this card to cancel that hit.
55.commanderAbility: When 1 or more of your units use: You may gain 1 trade good.
55.commanderUnlock: Have 5 structures on the game board.
55.heroAbility: Ready Elysium and attach this card to it. Its resource and influence values are each increased by 3, and it gains SPACE CANNON 5 (x3) ability as if it were a unit.

abilities.effect: After you explore a planet that does not have a sleeper token, you may place or move 1 sleeper token onto that planet.
After you activate a system that contains 1 or more of your sleeper tokens, you may replace each of those tokens with 1 PDS from your reinforcements.

technologies.deploy: After you activate a system that contains 1 or more of your PDS, you may replace 1 of those PDS with this unit.
When you would place a PDS on a planet, you may place 1 mech and 1 infantry on that planet instead.

technologies.effect: This unit is treated as both a structure and a ground force. It cannot be transported.
This unit is treated as both a structure and a ground force. It cannot be transported. You may use this unit’s SPACE CANNON against ships that are adjacent to this unit’s system.

promissory.effect: Attach this card to a non-home planet you control other than Mecatol Rex. Its resource and influence values are each increased by 1, and it is treated as having all 3 planet traits.

56.name: The Empyrean
56.agentAbility: After a player moves ships into a system that does not contain any planets: You may exhaust this card; that player gains 1 command token.
56.commanderAbility: After another player moves ships into a system that contains 1 of your command tokens: You may return that token to your reinforcements.
56.commanderUnlock: Be neighbors with all other players.
56.heroAbility: Place 1 frontier token in each system that does not contain any planets and does not already have a frontier token. Then, explore each frontier token that is in system that contains 1 or more of your ships. Then, purge this card.

abilities.effect: Nebulae do not affect your ships’ movement.
After a player activates a system, you may allow that player to move their ships through systems that contain your ships.
During setup, take the additional Empyrean faction promissory note; you have 2 faction promissory notes.

technologies.effect: After any player’s unit in this system or an adjacent system uses SUSTAIN DAMAGE, you may spend 2 influence to repair that unit.
You may remove this unit from a system that contains or is adjacent to another player’s units to cancel an action card played by that player.

technologies.description: After a player moves ships into a system that contains 1 or more of your units, they must give you 1 promissory note from their hand, if able.
After you or one of your neighbors activates a system that is adjacent to an anomaly, you may apply +1 to the move value of all of that player’s ships during this tactical action.

promissory.effect: Place this card faceup in your play area. When you and the Empyrean player cast votes for the same outcome, cast 4 additional votes for that outcome. If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Empyrean player’s units, return this card to the Empyrean player.

Place this card faceup in your play area. When you give a number of commodities to the Empyrean player equal to your maximum commodity value, you each gain 1 trade good.  If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Empyrean player’s units, return this card to the Empyrean player.

57.name: The Naaz-Rokha Alliance
57.agentAbility: At the end of a player's turn: You may exhaust this card to allow that player to explore 1 of their planets.
57.commanderAbility: After you gain control of a planet that was controlled by another player: You may explore that planet.
57.heroAbility: Gain 1 relic and perform the secondary ability of up to 2 readied or unchosen strategy cards; during this action, spend command tokens from your reinforcements instead of your strategy pool. Then, purge this card.

abilities.effect: When you explore a planet that contains 1 of your mechs, you may draw 1 additional card; choose 1 to resolve and discard the rest.
Either purge 2 of your relic fragments of the same type to gain 1 relic or purge 1 of your relic fragments to gain 1 command token.

technologies.effect: Your mechs in this system roll 1 additional die during combat.
If this unit is in the space area at the start of space combat, flip this card. This card begins the game with this side face up.
If this unit is in the space area of the active system, it is also a ship. At the end of a space battle in the active system, flip this card.

technologies.description: After you explore a planet, ready that planet.
At the start of a combat round, you may exhaust this card to apply +1 to the result of each of your unit’s combat rolls during this combat round.

promissory.effect: Purge 2 of your relic fragments of the same type to gain 1 relic. Then, return this card to the Naaz-Rokha player.

58.name: The Argent Flight
58.agentAbility: When a player produces ground forces in a system: You may exhaust this card; that player may place those units on any planets they control in that system and any adjacent systems.
58.commanderAbility: When 1 or more of your units make a roll for a unit ability: You may choose 1 of those units to roll 1 additional die.
58.commanderUnlock: Have 6 units that have ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE, SPACE CANNON or BOMBARDMENT on the game board.
58.heroAbility: Move any number of your ships from any systems to any number of other systems that contain 1 of your command tokens and no other player's ships. Then, purge this card.

abilities.effect: You always vote first during the agenda phase. When you cast at least 1 vote, cast 1 additional vote for each player in the game, including you.
When 1 or more of your units use ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE, for each hit produced in excess of your opponent’s fighters, choose 1 of your opponent’s ships that has SUSTAIN DAMAGE to become damaged.

technologies.effect: Other players cannot use SPACE CANNON against your ships in this system.
This unit does not count against capacity if it is being transported or if it is in a space area with 1 or more of your ships that have capacity values.

technologies.description: Other players cannot move ships through systems that contain your structures. Each planet that contains 1 or more of your structures gains the PRODUCTION 1 ability as if it were a unit.

promissory.effect: When 1 or more of your units make a roll for a unit ability: Choose 1 of those units to roll 1 additional die. Then, return this card to the Argent player.
